title: EDM v0.4 to v0.5 Migration Crosswalk
description: Documents changes from EDM v0.4.0 to v0.5.0. Enum expansions validated across 3 LLM providers.

enum_expansions.rationale: Phase 2 eval: LLMs consistently chose these over closest canonical value. Both Anthropic and OpenAI returned 'pride' for social achievement contexts, 'anxiety' for anticipatory worry (distinct from acute fear), 'gratitude' for relational appreciation (distinct from joy), and 'longing' for yearning/nostalgia-as-desire. Phase 2.5 gate run: 'hope' appeared 4 times across OpenAI and Kimi as consensus violation for future-oriented optimism distinct from joy.

Professional/B2B and customer support use cases have no representation. Both providers returned 'customer_service' (invalid) for support interactions. Therapeutic relationship common in journaling/therapy inputs. Adversarial covers conflict dynamics distinct from grief. Phase 2.2 + 2.5: 'family' captures multi-generational or collective family dynamics distinct from parent_child (which implies two-party, directional relationship).

Phase 2 eval: 'confront' appeared repeatedly from OpenAI (exists in coping_style but semantically needed in drive_state for behavioral direction). 'protect' captures defensive motivation distinct from 'avoid'. 'process' captures therapeutic motivation to work through/metabolize an experience - core to journaling and therapy use cases.

Phase 2.5 gate run: 'process' appeared 6 times from OpenAI as the strategy of working through/metabolizing an emotional experience. Semantically valid as a coping strategy distinct from reframing, distracting, or detaching. Note: 'process' also exists in drive_state (behavioral direction) â€” parallel to 'confront' existing in both fields.

Phase 2.5 gate run: 'emerging' appeared when the emotional adaptation trajectory is in early stages and direction is not yet clear. Captures the phase before improving/stable/declining can be determined.

bug_fixes.rationale: Constraint text was accidentally parsed as enum values during schema generation. Field should be free text (short sentence). x_constraints already correctly describes the expected format.

enum: emerging; NULL when pattern cannot be determined

bug_fixes.rationale: Description text concatenated into enum value. NULL guidance belongs in x_constraints only, not as a value option.

fields_unchanged: All field names, domain structure, and types remain identical to v0.4.0. This is an additive enum expansion only.

backward_compatibility.v04_to_v05: v0.4.0 artifacts remain valid under v0.5.0. All existing enum values are preserved.
backward_compatibility.v05_to_v04: v0.5.0 artifacts using new enum values will fail v0.4.0 strict validation. Migration would require mapping new values to closest v0.4 equivalents.

forward_compatibility.existing_artifacts: No migration required for existing v0.4.0 artifacts
forward_compatibility.new_extractions: New extractions may use expanded enum values
forward_compatibility.validation: v0.5.0 validators will accept all v0.4.0 values plus new expanded values

steps: 2. Update validators to accept expanded enum values
3. No field migration required - additive changes only
